DOC.brief_summary: This study is a 3-legged randomized study examining whether during shoulder surgery performed in the beach chair position active compressions of the lower leg with a sequential compression device (SCD) have a superior effect on stabilizing cerebral and circulatory hemodynamics when compared to TED stockings or a control group without any stockings.
DOC.brief_title: Sequential Compression Device (SCD) for Stabilizing Hemodynamics in the Beach Chair Position
DOC.detailed_description: This study examines whether during shoulder surgery performed in the beach chair position active compressions of the lower leg with a sequential compression device (SCD) have a superior effect on stabilizing cerebral and circulatory hemodynamics when compared to TED stockings or a control group without any stockings.
DOC.criteria: adult patients undergoing elective shoulder surgery untreated hypertension no pulse in a. dorsalis pedis or a.tibialis posterior leg ulcers failed scalenous blockade
